lines.content: Welcome to **Finch**, your personal task management chatbot! Finch helps you create, track, and organize your tasks in a simple and interactive way.
Finch supports the following types of tasks:
- Tasks with a due date and time.
- Tasks with a start and end date/time.
- Start and end date format: `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`
- Unmark a task as not done: `unmark 2`
- Remove a task from your list: `delete 3`
- Search for tasks by keyword: `find book`
- Returns all tasks whose description contains the keyword.
- View all tasks in your list: `list`
1. Run the Finch application (e.g., via `java -jar Finch.jar`).
2. Finch will display a welcome message and prompt you for input.
3. Enter commands following the syntax above.
4. Finch will confirm your actions and show the current task list.
5. Repeat as needed. Use `bye` to exit.
| `todo <desc>` | Add a ToDo task | `todo Read book` |
| `deadline <desc> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>` | Add a Deadline task | `deadline Submit report /by 2025-09-27 18:00` |
| `event <desc> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>` | Add an Event task | `event Team meeting /from 2025-09-28 14:00 /to 2025-09-28 15:30` |
- Finch saves tasks automatically to a local file so your data persists between sessions.
- Always use the correct date/time format for deadlines and events (`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`).
- If a command is entered incorrectly, Finch will display an error message with guidance.
Finch makes task management simple, interactive, and easy to keep track of your deadlines and events!
Welcome to **Finch**, your personal task management chatbot! Finch helps you create, track, and organize your tasks in a simple and interactive way.
Finch supports the following types of tasks:
- Tasks with a due date and time.
- Tasks with a start and end date/time.
- Start and end date format: `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`
- Unmark a task as not done: `unmark 2`
- Remove a task from your list: `delete 3`
- Search for tasks by keyword: `find book`
- Returns all tasks whose description contains the keyword.
- View all tasks in your list: `list`
1. Run the Finch application (e.g., via `java -jar Finch.jar`).
2. Finch will display a welcome message and prompt you for input.
3. Enter commands following the syntax above.
4. Finch will confirm your actions and show the current task list.
5. Repeat as needed. Use `bye` to exit.
| `todo <desc>` | Add a ToDo task | `todo Read book` |
| `deadline <desc> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>` | Add a Deadline task | `deadline Submit report /by 2025-09-27 18:00` |
| `event <desc> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>` | Add an Event task | `event Team meeting /from 2025-09-28 14:00 /to 2025-09-28 15:30` |
- Finch saves tasks automatically to a local file so your data persists between sessions.
- Always use the correct date/time format for deadlines and events (`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`).
- If a command is entered incorrectly, Finch will display an error message with guidance.
Finch makes task management simple, interactive, and easy to keep track of your deadlines and events!
* The main application class for Finch, a command-line task management chatbot.
* Finch handles loading and saving tasks from persistent storage, processing
* user commands, and interacting with the user via the {@link Ui} class.
// Handles reading from and writing to the data file (persistent storage for tasks)
// Use TaskList object to manage all tasks and task-related operations
// Handles all user interactions (messages, input prompts, error messages)

This constructor initializes the {@link Ui}, loads tasks from the

* gracefully if storage cannot be initialized.
* @param filePath the path to the data file where tasks are stored
tempStorage = new Storage(filePath); // may throw FinchException
loadedTasks = storage != null ? storage.load() : new TaskList();

* The main entry point for the Finch application.
* Represents the command to add a {@code Deadline} task in the Finch application.
* The {@code AddDeadlineCommand} parses user input, validates the description and
* deadline time, and when executed, adds the deadline task into the {@link TaskList},
* displays confirmation via the {@link Ui}, and saves the updated task list to {@link Storage}.
* Constructs an {@code AddDeadlineCommand} by parsing and validating the user input.
* @param arguments the raw argument string provided by the user
* @throws FinchException if the input is empty, missing '/by', has invalid date format,
*                        or if description/date fields are empty
throw new FinchException("Deadline command must be in this format: deadline <desc> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>");
throw new FinchException("Deadline command must contain '/by <date time>'");
throw new FinchException("Deadline description cannot be empty.");
throw new FinchException("Deadline date/time cannot be empty.");
throw new FinchException("Invalid date/time format. Use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm (e.g., 2025-09-26 18:00).");
* Executes the command by adding a new {@code Deadline} task to the task list.

*
  • Creates and appends a {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline

*
  • Displays a confirmation message to the user

*
  • Saves the updated task list to persistent storage
* @param tasks   the {@link TaskList} to which the task is added
* @param ui      the {@link Ui} for showing feedback to the user
* @param storage the {@link Storage} for saving the updated task list
* @throws FinchException if saving fails or if task creation is invalid
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws FinchException {
* Indicates whether this command exits the program.
* @return {@code false} as this command does not terminate the program
* Represents the command to add an {@code Event} task in the Finch application.
* The {@code AddEventCommand} parses user input, validates the description and
* start/end times, and when executed, adds the event task into the {@link TaskList},
* displays confirmation via the {@link Ui}, and saves the updated task list to {@link Storage}.
* Constructs an {@code AddEventCommand} by parsing and validating the user input.
* @param arguments the raw argument string provided by the user
* @throws FinchException if the input is empty, missing required fields,
*                        has invalid date formats, or has inconsistent dates
throw new FinchException("Event command must be in this format: event <desc> /from <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm> /to <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>");
throw new FinchException("Event command must contain '/from <start>' and '/to <end>'");
throw new FinchException("'/from' must come before '/to'");
throw new FinchException("Event command must contain both '/from <start>' and '/to <end>'");
throw new FinchException("Event description cannot be empty.");
throw new FinchException("Event start date/time (/from) cannot be empty.");
throw new FinchException("Event end date/time (/to) cannot be empty.");
throw new FinchException("Invalid date/time format. Use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm (e.g., 2025-09-26 14:00).");
throw new FinchException("Event end date/time cannot be before start date/time.");

* The {@code Ui} class handles all user interactions in the Finch application.
* It is responsible for displaying messages, prompts, and errors to the user,
* as well as reading input commands from the console.

*
  • Displaying the welcome message with ASCII art at startup

*
  • Showing task lists, errors, and success messages

*
  • Displaying feedback when tasks are added, deleted, marked, or unmarked

*
  • Providing a list of all available commands
* Constructs a {@code Ui} instance and initializes the Scanner

// Divider string for consistent output formatting

// Displays the welcome message when the application starts
System.out.println("    What can I do for you?");
* Reads a full line of input entered by the user.
// Show goodbye message when the application exits

System.out.println("    Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in your list.");
